results.title: Australia presents: Christmas in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mason
results.brief_description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. The old traditions are preserved.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jack S. Allan, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mason
results.description: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.
description_for_label: Australia’s Christmas is not the traditional day of snow and ice, but a warm sweltering day in mid-summer. This film shows typical scenes of Christmas celebrations in 1950’s Australia, from the busy shops and streets of the cities, to small churches of rural country towns, even a festive feast at the beach.

results.title: Australia presents world of birds
results.brief_description: Australian birds building their nests and rearing their young. Those shown include the buff-tailed hornbill, the speckled warbler, the rainbow bird, the emu, fairy penguins, black swans, willie wagtails, kookaburra, and lyrebirds.

results.title: Australia marches with Britain
results.creator_credit: National Films Council and Ken G. Hall
results.brief_description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. Industry producing metals, Bren Gun carriers, shells, guns, ships, planes, exporting the lot to England. Total war effort to fight enemy. Australian Army, Navy and Air Force personnel training and embarking for service overseas. Commentary by Peter Bathurst.
results.creator_credit_for_label: National Films Council and Ken G. Hall
results.description: Highlights of the National War Effort. Reaping the wheat, shearing sheep, producing butter, eggs, felling trees for timber. results.title: Australia makes aircraft
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mitchell
results.brief_description: The Department of Supply is the centre of the Australian aircraft industry. Film shows the manufacture of military aircraft in Australia. Includes production and assembly of a Mirage supersonic fighter and its Atar engine and shows briefly the design, testing and maintenance facilities of the department.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Malcolm Otton, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Richard Mitchell

results.title: Australia in the 80's
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Film Australia and John Leake
results.brief_description: This film presents the variety and vigour of a nation still developing. Includes sequences of travel on the famous Indian Pacific railway between Port Pirie and Kalgoorlie, the nomad aircraft coastal surveillance, the gasfields of Moomba, and the Sepeltsfield wine-growing area in the Barossa Valley

results.title: Australia in New Guinea
results.brief_description: Traces the development of North East New Guinea under mandate to Australia by the League of Nations. The film contrasts conditions in pre-war years with reconstruction and development during recent years; cutting and milling of timber; construction of pre-fabricated houses and other buildings; education of natives; an experimental project for raising sheep, shearing and weaving wool. No other credits available.
